sentences.sContent: ...After graduating with a degree in business and accounting...

...The answer used to be two-year associate's or four-year bachelor's degree programs...
...a college degree becomes a job requirement for becoming a bar-tender...
...a college degree alone does not guarantee a good job for its holder...
...recently told me that a college degree alone is no longer a guarantor of a good job...
...Those with a doctoral degree earn nearly 3...
...I’ve got a degree in English.M: You said you’ve been working in Geneva...
...Doctor Joanna Mayer treated a child who had suffered a second degree burn...
...and they develop a high degree of loyalty from local reader...
...you may not know that he also holds a master's degree in criminology and studied abroad for a year with the international police force which deals with crimes around the world...

trans.tranOther: a unit for measuring temperature. It can be shown as a symbol after a number. For example, 70° means 70 degrees.
